### Input:
 Even though backslash is not a legal URI character in HTTP/1.1 one could interpret HTTP/1.0 ( RFC 1945 ) so that is is a legal URI character ( in section 3.2.1 ; work your way from abs_path and rel_path through path , fsegment , segment , pchar , uchar , unreserved and then you find national . It is defined as `` any OCTET excluding ALPHA , DIGIT , reserved , extra , safe , and unsafe '' of which none includes backslash ) . It looks like Mozilla does not even try to load a URI with a backslash in it . Navigator 4.61 loads it as it is and IE 5 remap backslash to slash . 

### Remembering the instruction:
Categorize the bug report into one of 2 categories:

0 = NOT SEVERE
1 = SEVERE

### Response:

(1, 0).description: Even though backslash is not a legal URI character in HTTP/1.1 one could interpret HTTP/1.0 ( RFC 1945 ) so that is is a legal URI character ( in section 3.2.1 ; work your way from abs_path and rel_path through path , fsegment , segment , pchar , uchar , unreserved and then you find national . It is defined as `` any OCTET excluding ALPHA , DIGIT , reserved , extra , safe , and unsafe '' of which none includes backslash ) . It looks like Mozilla does not even try to load a URI with a backslash in it . Navigator 4.61 loads it as it is and IE 5 remap backslash to slash .

Targets like < a href= '' # 1 '' > 1 < /a > then < a name= '' 1 '' > < /a > 1 does not landing in the right spot . The target is move up just a little high in mozilla vs Netscape . For a good example go to URL Make sure your browser window is short engough that much of the second set of nubmers are not seen without scrolling down . Then click on one of top number links at the top like `` 1 '' . In netscape you can correctly seee the `` 1 '' the browser jumped to . However in Mozilla you actually have to scroll back up a little to see the `` 1 '' you jumped to . I hoope that is clear . I had a hard time trying to explain it .

(1, 0).description: I figured this bug already existed , but could not find it ... Mozilla 1/4/00 build . Targets like < a href= '' # 1 '' > 1 < /a > then < a name= '' 1 '' > < /a > 1 does not landing in the right spot . The target is move up just a little high in mozilla vs Netscape . For a good example go to URL Make sure your browser window is short engough that much of the second set of nubmers are not seen without scrolling down . Then click on one of top number links at the top like `` 1 '' . In netscape you can correctly seee the `` 1 '' the browser jumped to . However in Mozilla you actually have to scroll back up a little to see the `` 1 '' you jumped to . I hoope that is clear . I had a hard time trying to explain it .

### Input:
 When nesting the `` Q '' element for quotations , and lang= '' en '' the inner nested quotation should be in single quotes . I 'll attach an example page .  Created by David Nebinger ( dnebinger @ synertech.highmark.com ) on Tuesday , April 14 , 1998 11:20:12 AM PDT Additional Details : Netscape compile fails on line # 124 of ns/modules/libpref/src/prefapi.c . Changing the line from : XP_FREEIF ( ( void * ) he- > key ) ; to : XP_FREEIF ( he- > key ) ; fixes the problem . If other compilers complain about the missing typecast , potential resolution would be to create a new macro that takes the type as an argument . Instead of using the macro : # define XP_FREEIF ( obj ) do { if ( obj ) { XP_FREE ( obj ) ; obj = 0 ; } } while ( 0 ) try the macro : # define XP_FREEIFTYPE ( obj , typ ) do { if ( obj ) { XP_FREE ( obj ) ; obj = ( typ ) 0 ; } } while ( 0 ) with line # 124 as XP_FREEIFTYPE ( he- > key , void * ) ; Thanks

After watching the NT Task Manager , we have found that the process netscape.exe keeps requesting memory until about 12000K at which point Netscape crashes ( using 32 MB of RAM . ) Numerous messages occur with the lack of Virutal Memory . We are looking for a confirmation on this finding . I already looked at developer.netscape.com and home.netscape.com without finding any whitepapers on the topic . Updated by ( blythe @ netscape.com ) on Tuesday , June 9 , 1998 4:19:17 PM PDT Additional Details : Will assign to danm @ netscape.com as soon as they add to AssignTo field .
